timeline.message:
Fix LoadFlowParameters copy.

Copy extensions via serialize instance.
Fix usage in SecurityAnalysisImpl.

Signed-off-by: yichen88 <tang.yichenyves@gmail.com>

Proposition to fix jackson dependency management.

The version of jackson-core and jackson-annotations pulled by blazegraph
were not compatible with the version of jackson-databind used by the project.

Signed-off-by: Sylvain Leclerc <sylvain.leclerc@rte-france.com>

Proposition to fix jackson dependency management.

The version of jackson-core and jackson-annotations pulled by blazegraph
were not compatible with the version of jackson-databind used by the project.

Signed-off-by: Sylvain Leclerc <sylvain.leclerc@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Why do you use ByteArrayBuilder?  Why don't you use ByteArrayOutputStream?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText:
From doc, it seems like it is a better usage here.

Since version 1.5, also implements OutputStream to allow efficient aggregation of output content as a byte array, similar to how ByteArrayOutputStream works, but somewhat more efficiently for many use cases.

https://fasterxml.github.io/jackson-core/javadoc/2.3.0/com/fasterxml/jackson/core/util/ByteArrayBuilder.html
replies.author: yichen88

replies.bodyText: We could probably keep ByteArrayBuilder then...
replies.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
